Author: Diane Setterfield,  The Thirteenth Tale
Quote: Like flies in amber, like corpses frozen in ice, that which according to the laws of nature should pass away is, by the miracle of ink on paper, preserved. It is a kind of magic. As one tends the graves of the dead, so I tend the books. And every day I open a volume or two, read a few lines or pages, allow the voices of the forgotten dead to resonate inside my head.

Author: Pope John XXIII
Quote: ... just as food is necessary to the life of the body, so good reading is necessary to the life of the soul.

Author: John Lothrop Motley
Quote: You will find most books worth reading are worth reading twice.

Author: Christopher Morley,  The Haunted Bookshop
Quote: Printer's ink has been running a race against gunpowder these many, many years. Ink is handicapped, in a way, because you can blow up a man with gunpowder in half a second, while it may take twenty years to blow him up with a book. But the gunpowder destroys itself along with its victim, while a book can keep on exploding for centuries.

Author: William Ellery Channing
Quote: Reading is the royal road to intellectual eminence...Truly good books are more than mines to those who can understand them. They are the breathings of the great souls of past times. Genius is not embalmed in them, but lives in them perpetually.

Author: Nicole Krauss,  Great House
Quote: When at last I came upon the right book, the feeling was violent: it blew open a hole in me that made life more dangerous because I couldn't control what came through it.

Author: Ray Bradbury,  Fahrenheit 451
Quote: Books were only one type of receptacle where we stored a lot of things we were afraid we might forget. There is nothing magical in them at all. The magic is only in what books say, how they stitched the patches of the Universe together into one garment for us.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Xazaqazax
Quote: I always thought it was Mo Be Dick. I know Mo, and he is a dick.

Author: Thomas à Kempis
Quote: A book has but one voice, but it does not instruct everyone alike.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: A capacity, and taste, for reading, gives access to whatever has already been discovered by others. It is the key, or one of the keys, to the already solved problems. And not only so. It gives a relish, and facility, for successfully pursuing the [yet] unsolved ones.

Author: Isaac Asimov
Quote: What I will be remembered for are the Foundation Trilogy and the Three Laws of Robotics. What I want to be remembered for is no one book, or no dozen books. Any single thing I have written can be paralleled or even surpassed by something someone else has done. However, my total corpus for quantity, quality and variety can be duplicated by no one else. That is what I want to be remembered for.

Author: Ian Falconer,  Olivia
Quote: Only five books tonight, Mommy,"she says.No, Olivia, just one."How about four?"Two."Three."Oh, all right, three. But that's it!

Author: Orson Scott Card
Quote: Anything can become a children's book if you give it to a child...Children are actually the best (and worst) audience for literature because they have no patience with pretence.

Author: Alberto Manguel,  The Library at Night
Quote: My books hold between their covers every story I've ever known and still remember, or have now forgotten, or may one day read; they fill the space around me with ancient and new voices.

Author: Hope Bradford,  Beneficial Law of Attraction: The Manifestation Teachings
Quote: Everyone creates realities based on their own personal beliefs. These beliefs are so powerful that they can create [expansive or entrapping] realities over and over.~Kuan Yin

Author: Marie Rutkoski,  The Winner's Crime
Quote: She’d felt it before, she felt it now: the pull to fall in with him, to fall into him, to lose her sense of self.

Author: Marie Rutkoski,  The Winner's Crime
Quote: An emotion clamped down on her heart. It squeezed her into a terrible silence. But he said nothing after that, only her name, as if her name were not a name but a question. Or perhaps that it wasn’t how he had said it, and she was wrong, and she’d heard a question simply because the sound of him speaking her name made her wish that she were his answer.

Author: Stéphane Mallarmé
Quote: The flesh is sad, alas, and I have read all the books.

Author: Regina Doman
Quote: One of my heroes, G.K. Chesterton, said, "The old fairy tales endure forever. The old fairy tale makes the hero a normal human boy; it is his adventures that are startling; they startle him because he is normal."Discovering that the modern world can still contain the wonder and strangeness of a fairy tale is part of what my novels are about.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Tis the good reader that makes the good book; in every book he finds passages which seem confidences or asides hidden from all else and unmistakenly meant for his ear; the profit of books is according to the sensibility of the reader; the profoundest thought or passion sleeps as in a mine, until it is discovered by an equal mind and heart.

Author: Rick Riordan,  The Red Pyramid
Quote: To all my librarian friends, champions of books, true magicians in the House of Life. Without you, this writer would be lost in the Dust.

Author: Martha Cooley,  The Archivist
Quote: In a few minutes I heard the books' voices: a low, steady, unsupressible hum. I'd heard it many times before. I've always had a finely tuned ear for a library's accumulations of echo and desire. Libraries are anything but hushed.

Author: Patrick Rothfuss,  The Name of the Wind
Quote: There were two sets of double doors leading out of the antechamber, one marked STACKS and the other TOMES. Not knowing the difference between the two, I headed to the ones labeled STACKS. That was what I wanted. Stacks of books. Great heaps of books. Shelf after endless shelf of books.

Author: Tracy Letts,  August: Osage County
Quote: My last refuge, my books: simple pleasures, like finding wild onions by the side of a road, or requited love.

Author: Jane Yolen,  Girl in a Cage
Quote: A book is a wonderful present. Though it may grow worn, it will never grow old.

Author: Lauren Hammond
Quote: A good book will pull you in from the beginning and take you on a journey you'll never forget.

Author: Rosamund Hodge,  Cruel Beauty
Quote: I remember the hours I had spent in Father's library, drugging myself with books so I could forget my doom for an hour..

Author: George Herbert
Quote: Woe be to him that reads but one book.

Author: Harlan Ellison
Quote: Now begin in the middle, and later learn the beginning; the end will take care of itself.

Author: Vladimir Nabokov
Quote: Lolita is famous, not I. I am an obscure, doubly obscure, novelist with an unpronounceable name.

Author: William Shakespeare
Quote: Knowing I lov'd my books, he furnish'd me From mine own library with volumes that I prize above my dukedom.

Author: Andrei Tarkovsky
Quote: A book read by a thousand different people is a thousand different books.

Author: Dejan Stojanovic,  The Sun Watches the Sun
Quote: Even if you are alone you wage war with yourself.

Author: Billy Collins,  Picnic, Lightning
Quote: It is time to float on the waters of the night. Time to wrap my arms around this book and press it to my chest, life preserver in a sea of unremarkable men and women, anonymous faces on the street, a hundred thousand unalphabetized things, a million forgotten hours.

Author: Jerry Spinelli
Quote: Tell me I didn't imagine it, Leo. Tell me that even though our bodies were in seperate states, our star selves shared an enchanted place. Tell me that right around noon today (eastern time) you had the strangest sensation: a tiny chill on your shoulder...a flutter in the heart...a shadow of strawberry-banana crossing your tongue...tell me you whispered my name.

Author: Joseph Henry Jackson
Quote: Did you ever hear anyone say, 'That work had better be banned because I might read it and it might be very damaging to me'?

Author: Virginia Woolf,  Jacob's Room
Quote: Every face, every shop, bedroom window, public-house, and dark square is a picture feverishly turned--in search of what? It is the same with books. What do we seek through millions of pages?

Author: Jodi Picoult,  Between the Lines
Quote: This must be what an addict feels like, I think, trying to fight the pull of one last, quick read. My fingers itch toward the binding, and finally, with a sigh of regret, I just grab the book and open it, hungrily reading the story.

Author: Jo Walton,  Among Others
Quote: The thing about Tolkien, about The Lord of the Rings, is that it's perfect. It's this whole world, this whole process of immersion, this journey. It's not, I'm pretty sure, actually true, but that makes it more amazing, that someone could make it all up. Reading it changes everything.

Author: Nick Hornby,  Housekeeping vs. the Dirt
Quote: And what would happen if we never read the classics? There comes a point in life, it seems to me, where you have to decide whether you're a Person of Letters or merely someone who loves books, and I'm beginning to see that the book lovers have more fun.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Xazaqazax
Quote: As a fan of Agatha Christie, I think a brilliant mystery novel would be trying to identify the meat contents in a McDonald’s hamburger.

Author: Kate Morton,  The Distant Hours
Quote: My fingers positively itched to drift at length along their spines, to arrive at one whose lure I could not pass, to pluck it down, to inch it open, then to close my eyes and inhale the soul-sparking scent of old and literate dust.

Author: Zoë Marriott
Quote: I truly believe that if you have more friends than books, you have too many friends. Or not enough books. Probably both.

Author: Christopher Morley
Quote: The real purpose of books is to trap the mind into doing its own thinking.

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: The dirtiest book of all is the expurgated book.

Author: Virginia Woolf,  Jacob's Room
Quote: anyone who’s worth anything reads just what he likes, as the mood takes him, and with extravagant enthusiasm.

Author: Andrew Lang
Quote: You can cover a great deal of country in books.

Author: Stephen R. Covey,  The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People: Powerful Lessons in Personal Change
Quote: There's no better way to inform and expand you mind on a regular basis than to get into the habit of reading good literature.

Author: Alberto Manguel,  The Library at Night
Quote: I have no feelings of guilt regarding the books I have not read and perhaps will never read; I know that my books have unlimited patience. They will wait for me till the end of my days.

Author: Woody Allen
Quote: I read in self-defense.

Author: Benjamin Disraeli
Quote: When I want to read a novel, I write one.

Author: Penelope Fitzgerald,  The Bookshop
Quote: A good book is the precious life-blood of a master-spirit, embalmed and treasured up on purpose to a life beyond life, and as such it must surely be a necessary commodity.

Author: Jean Rhys,  Quartet
Quote: Not that she objected to solitude. Quite the contrary. She had books, thank Heaven, quantities of books. All sorts of books.

Author: Paula Fox
Quote: When you read to a child, when you put a book in a child's hands, you are bringing that child news of the infinitely varied nature of life. You are an awakener.

Author: Keith Donohue
Quote: Write it down, boy. If you come across a passage in your reading that you’d like to remember, write it down in your little book; then you can read it again, memorize it, and have it whenever you wish.

Author: Annie Dillard
Quote: Books swept me away, this way and that, one after the other; I made endless vows according to their lights for I believed them.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Quote: A book is an arrangement of twenty-six phonetic symbols, ten numerals, and about eight punctuation marks, and people can cast their eyes over these and envision the eruption of Mount Vesuvius or the Battle of Waterloo.

Author: Michael Chabon
Quote: All novels are sequels; influence is bliss.

Author: Catherine Fisher
Quote: And what would they be scared of? There's nothing to fear in a perfect world, is there?

Author: Betty Smith,  A Tree Grows in Brooklyn
Quote: The library was a little old shabby place. Francie thought it was beautiful. The feeling she had about it was as good as the feeling she had about church. She pushed open the door and went in. She liked the combined smell of worn leather bindings, library past and freshly inked stamping pads better than she liked the smell of burning incense at high mass.

Author: Laurence J. Peter
Quote: A censor is an expert in cutting remarks. A censor is a man who knows more than he thinks you ought to.

Author: Karl Lagerfeld
Quote: For every book you buy, you should buy the time to read it.

Author: D.H. Lawrence,  Apocalypse
Quote: We are so overwhelmed with quantities of books, that we hardly realize any more that a book can be valuable, valuable like a jewel, or a lovely picture, into which you can look deeper and deeper and get a more profound experience very time. It is far, far better to read one book six times, at intervals, than to read six several books.

Author: David Mitchell,  Cloud Atlas
Quote: Mother used to say escape is never further than the nearest book.

Author: A. Edward Newton,  A Magnificent Farce And Other Diversions Of A Book Collector
Quote: Who was it who said, "I hold the buying of more books than one can peradventure read, as nothing less than the soul's reaching towards infinity; which is the only thing that raises us above the beasts that perish?"Whoever it was, I agree with him.

Author: Mick Foley
Quote: A big book is like a serious relationship; it requires a commitment. Not only that, but there's no guarantee that you will enjoy it, or that it will have a happy ending. Kind of like going out with a girl, having to spend time every day with her - with absolutely no guarantee of nailing her in the end. No thanks.

Author: Wilferd Peterson
Quote: It is time to browse through the precious books that have meant the most to you that you may rediscover illuminating phrases and sentences to light your pathway to the future...

Author: Karen Joy Fowler
Quote: There was something appealing in thinking of a character with a secret life that her author knew nothing about. Slipping off while the author's back was turned, to find love in her own way. Showing up just in time to deliver the next bit of dialogue with an innocent face.

Author: Ellen Rose
Quote: Cakes are like books: There are new ones you want to read and old favorites you want to reread.

Author: Nora Roberts,  Morrigan's Cross
Quote: Remind me not to piss you off Red. You might aim for the heart and shoot me in the balls.

Author: Г. Аюурзана,  Амь тавьж буй шувууны далавч
Quote: Амьдрал гэж нэг иймэрхүү авсаархан ном байлаа гэхэд, санаандгүй сөхөхөд тааралдах тохиолдлын ганц өгүүлбэрт л уг номыг унших учир шалтгаан бүрэн шингээстэй бий.

Author: Tom Stoppard,  Arcadia
Quote: What are a friend's books for if not to be borrowed?

Author: Ross Macdonald
Quote: The walls of books around him, dense with the past, formed a kind of insulation against the present world and its disasters.

Author: نجلاء حسن,  قلب صام عن هوى الرجال
Quote: أمقت تلك المسافات التي تفصلني عنك ،أتذمر من تلك المواقيت التي تسرقني منك ..أسخط على أعين تتأملك / على أنامل تلمسكعلى أنفاسك وهي تستنشقك !على نبضاتك وهي تستشعرك ، على ثيابك وهي تعانقك

Author: Amy Lowell
Quote: For books are more than books, they are the lifeThe very heart and core of ages past,The reason why men lived and worked and died,The essence and quintessence of their lives.

Author: Richard Steele
Quote: Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body.

Author: Cesare Pavese,  Il mestiere di vivere: Diario 1935-1950
Quote: The words that strike us are those that awake an echo in a zone we have already made our own—the place where we live—and the vibration enables us to find fresh starting points within ourselves.

Author: Anne Fadiman,  Ex Libris: Confessions of a Common Reader
Quote: In my view, nineteen pounds of old books are at least nineteen times as delicious as one pound of fresh caviar.

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: When I touched her body,I believed she was God.In the curves of her formI found the birth of Man,the creation of the world,and the origin of all life.

Author: John Burroughs,  The Summit of the Years
Quote: I go to books and to nature as the bee goes to a flower, for a nectar that I can make into my own honey.

Author: Gabriel Zaid,  So Many Books: Reading and Publishing in an Age of Abundance
Quote: The truly cultured are capable of owning thousands of unread books without losing their composure or their desire for more.

Author: Gabrielle Zevin
Quote: When I was in my twenties and broke, I'd buy books before food. A meal will sustain you for a few hours, a good book will sustain you for life.

Author: Rick Holland
Quote: The world belongs to those who read.

Author: Alberto Manguel,  The Library at Night
Quote: If every library is in some sense a reflection of its readers, it is also an image of that which we are not, and cannot be.

Author: Saul Bellow,  Ravelstein
Quote: Associate with the noblest people you can find; read the best books; live with the mighty; but learn to be happy alone.

Author: Geraldine Brooks,  People of the Book
Quote: Book burnings. Always the forerunners. Heralds of the stake, the ovens, the mass graves.

Author: Kelly Link
Quote: Remember, when you don’t know what to do, it never hurts to play Scrabble. It’s like reading the I Ching or tea leaves.

Author: Lemony Snicket,  Horseradish
Quote: Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them

Author: Nick Hornby,  Housekeeping vs. the Dirt
Quote: I would like my personal reading map to resemble a map of the British Empire circa 1900.

Author: Alberto Manguel,  The Library at Night
Quote: Readers, censors know, are defined by the books they read.

Author: Laurie Halse Anderson,  Chains
Quote: I wanted to pull down a book, open it proper, and gobble up page after page

Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout,  Opal
Quote: This isn't a book. This isn't a paranormal fantasy or whatever the hell it is you read. There is no set plot or clear idea of where any of this is going. The enemies aren't obvious. There are no guaranteed happy endings.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: If the self-help books worked, it would be a shrinking industry not a growing one.

Author: Russell Brand,  My Booky Wook
Quote: And while we're on the subject of ducks, which we plainly are, the story, 'The Ugly Duckling' ought be banned as the central character wasn't a duckling or he wouldn't have grown up into a swan. He was a cygnet.

Author: Winston S. Churchill
Quote: Writing a long and substantial book is like having a friend and companion at your side, to whom you can always turn for comfort and amusement, and whose society becomes more attractive as a new and widening field of interest is lighted in the mind.

Author: Carlos Fuentes
Quote: One wants to tell a story, like Scheherezade, in order not to die. It's one of the oldest urges in mankind. It's a way of stalling death.

Author: Alma Alexander
Quote: If you really want to be a writer, nobody can stop you -- and if you don't, nobody can help you.

Author: David Bowie
Quote: What is the quality you most like in a man? The ability to return books.

Author: Joseph Joubert
Quote: لا أحب الكتب الجديدة .. أنها تمنعني من قراءة الكتب القديمة

Author: Umberto Eco,  The Name of the Rose
Quote: A book is a fragile creature, it suffers the wear of time, it fears rodents, the elements and clumsy hands. so the librarian protects the books not only against mankind but also against nature and devotes his life to this war with the forces of oblivion.

Author: Thorne Smith
Quote: She reads a lot of books. Good things, books.

Author: Douglas Rushkoff
Quote: Computers don't kill books; people do.

Author: Rabih Alameddine,  An Unnecessary Woman
Quote: I long ago abandoned myself to a blind lust for the written word. Literature is my sandbox. In it I play, build my forts and castles, spend glorious time.

Author: Lemony Snicket,  The Bad Beginning
Quote: All his life, Klaus had believed that if you read enough books, you could solve any problem, but now he wasn't so sure.

Author: Emma Clayton,  The Roar
Quote: Helen's books were her friends, "the kind you invite for dinner in the middle of winter,"she'd told him, "and spend all night talking and never go to bed.

Author: Mary Carolyn Davies
Quote: We are made wholeBy books, as by great spaces and the stars

Author: Daniel J. Boorstin
Quote: A wonderful thing about a book, in contrast to a computer screen, is that you can take it to bed with you.

Author: Alberto Manguel,  The Library at Night
Quote: Unpacking books is a revelatory activity.

Author: Edith Wharton,  The House of Mirth
Quote: Don't you ever mind,"she asked suddenly, "not being rich enough to buy all the books you want?

Author: Stefan Zweig,  The Post-Office Girl
Quote: For this quiet, unprepossessing, passive man who has no garden in front of his subsidised flat, books are like flowers. He loves to line them up on the shelf in multicoloured rows: he watches over each of them with an old-fashioned gardener's delight, holds them like fragile objects in his thin, bloodless hands.

Author: Matt Haig,  The Humans
Quote: There is only one genre in fiction, the genre is called book.

Author: Morrissey
Quote: With no reason to hide these words I feel, and no reason to talk about the books I read, but still, I do.

Author: Tom Wolfe
Quote: The reason a writer writes a book is to forget a book and the reason a reader reads one is to remember it.

Author: Robert Clark
Quote: Always buy pornographic books in hardback because they're easier to hold with one hand.

Author: Ray Bradbury,  Fahrenheit 451
Quote: Maybe the books can get us half out of the cave. They just might stop us from making the same damm insane mistakes!

Author: Charles Lamb
Quote: I love to lose myself in other men's minds.... Books think for me.

Author: John Kieran
Quote: I am a part of all I have read.

Author: Rick Riordan,  The Lost Hero
Quote: And of course I'm in the press all the time. So many books have been written about me; Into thin air, up in the air,Gone with the wind-

Author: نجلاء حسن,  قلب صام عن هوى الرجال
Quote: أنا أخبئ بين أقفاص صدري أوجاع نساء الأرض ودموع الصغار ،أنا أحمل على عاتقي خيبات ثكلى !وفي حنجرتي تستقر حشرجة حزن مدوية ..أنا الأنثى التي تقام كل ليلة على مدائن قلبهامآتم الخذلان !وبالرغم من ذلك الأسى المفرط .. .تبتسم وتمضي دونما إكتراث !

Author: Lin Yutang
Quote: The wise man reads both books and life itself.

Author: Jorge Luis Borges
Quote: Paradise will be a kind of library

Author: Alberto Manguel,  A History of Reading
Quote: Readers are bullied in schoolyards and in locker-rooms as much as in government offices and prisons.

Author: Alberto Manguel,  The Library at Night
Quote: But at night, when the library lamps are lit, the outside world disappears and nothing but the space of books remains in existence.

Author: Salman Rushdie
Quote: A book is a version of the world. If you do not like it, ignore it; or offer your own version in return.

Author: Pamela Dean
Quote: It did occur to me that the effect of good literature may be as dizzying as that of alcohol.

Author: R. Peck
Quote: I read because one life isn't enough, and in the page of a book I can be anybody.

Author: Leonard Cohen,  Beautiful Losers
Quote: I've forgotten most of what I've read and, frankly, it never seemed very important to me or to the world.

Author: Anatole Broyard
Quote: The contents of someone's bookcase are part of his history, like an ancestral portrait."(About Books; Recoiling, Rereading, Retelling, New York Times, February 22, 1987)

Author: Stéphane Mallarmé
Quote: The world exists to end up in a book.

Author: Robert Maynard Hutchins,  The Great Conversation: The Substance Of A Liberal Education
Quote: Nobody can decide for himself whether he is going to be a human being. The only question open to him is whether he will be an ignorant undeveloped one or one who has sought to reach the highest point he is capable of attaining.

Author: Jeanette Winterson,  Why Be Happy When You Could Be Normal?
Quote: Books, for me, are a home. Books don't make a home - they are one, in the sense that just as you do with a door, you open a book, and you go inside. Inside there is a different kind of time and space. There is warmth there too - a hearth. I sit down with a book and I am warm.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut,  Slaughterhouse-Five
Quote: There isn’t any particular relationship between the messages, except that the author has chosen them carefully, so that, when seen all at once, they produce an image of life that is beautiful and surprising and deep. There is no beginning, no middle, no end, no suspense, no moral, no causes, no effects. What we love in our books are the depths of many marvelous moments seen all at one time.

Author: Henry Stevens
Quote: Books are both our luxuries and our daily bread.

Author: Dejan Stojanovic,  The Sun Watches the Sun
Quote: You not only are hunted by others, you unknowingly hunt yourself.

Author: Stephen King
Quote: The glory of a good tale is that it is limitless and fluid; a good tale belongs to each reader in its own particular way.

Author: Holbrook Jackson
Quote: A good book is always on tap; it may be decanted and drunk a hundred times, and it is still there for further imbibement.

Author: Alberto Manguel,  The Library at Night
Quote: In a library, no empty shelf remains empty for long.

Author: Katherine Paterson
Quote: The wonderful thing about books is that they allow us to enter imaginatively into someone else’s life. And when we do that, we learn to sympathize with other people. But the real surprise is that we also learn truths about ourselves, about our own lives, that somehow we hadn’t been able to see before.

Author: Virginia Woolf,  Jacob's Room
Quote: I like books whose virtue is all drawn together in a page or two. I like sentences that don't budge though armies cross them.

Author: Gary Snyder,  The Practice of the Wild: Essays
Quote: In Western Civilization, our elders are books.

Author: Elizabeth McCracken,  The Giant's House
Quote: Books remember all the things you cannot contain.

Author: Christopher Isherwood,  A Single Man
Quote: The prefect evening...lying down on the couch beside the bookcase and reading himself sleepy...Jim lying opposite him at the other end of the couch, also reading; the two of them absorbed in their books yet so completely aware of each other's presence.

Author: Nova Ren Suma,  The Walls Around Us
Quote: Our private tastes in books showed a hint of our secret selves.

Author: Aberjhani,  Journey through the Power of the Rainbow: Quotations from a Life Made Out of Poetry
Quote: In your hands winteris a book with cloud pagesthat snow pearls of love.

Author: Wally Lamb,  I Know This Much Is True
Quote: -- that books were mirrors, reflective in sometimes unpredictable ways.

Author: Alberto Manguel,  The Library at Night
Quote: Old books that we have known but not possessed cross our path and invite themselves over. New books try to seduce us daily with tempting titles and tantalizing covers.

Author: Lawrence Clark Powell
Quote: To achieve lasting literature, fictional or factual, a writer needs perceptive vision, absorptive capacity, and creative strength.

Author: Patrick O'Brian,  The Nutmeg of Consolation
Quote: Sir,’ said Stephen, ‘I read novels with the utmost pertinacity. I look upon them--I look upon good novels--as a very valuable part of literature, conveying more exact and finely-distinguished knowledge of the human heart and mind than almost any other, with greater breadth and depth and fewer constraints.

Author: Betty Smith,  A Tree Grows in Brooklyn
Quote: But the penciled sheets did not seem like nor smell like the library book so she had given it up, consoling herself with the vow that when she grew up, she would work hard, save money and buy every single book that she liked.

Author: Edwin Percy Whipple
Quote: Books are lighthouses erected in the great sea of time.

Author: Augustine Birrell
Quote: Libraries are not made; they grow. Good as it is to inherit a library, it is better to collect one.

Author: Eleanor Brown,  The Weird Sisters
Quote: We were never organized readers who would see a book through to its end in any sory of logical order. We weave in and out of words like tourists on a hop-on, hop-off bus tour. Put a book down in the kitchen to go to the bathroom and you might return to find it gone, replaced by another of equal interest. We are indiscriminate.

Author: Laura Hillenbrand,  Seabiscuit: An American Legend
Quote: He had no money and no home; he lived entirely on the road of the racing circuit, sleeping in empty stalls, carrying with him only a saddle, his rosary, and his books....The books were the closest thing he had to furniture, and he lived in them the way other men live in easy chairs.

Author: Douglas Rushkoff
Quote: Books have souls. Or so romantics like me tend to think.

Author: W.B. Yeats,  The Winding Stair and Other Poems
Quote: I sat, a solitary man,In a crowded London shop,An open book and empty cupOn the marble table-top.While on the shop and street I gazedMy body of a sudden blazed;And twenty minutes more or lessIt seemed, so great my happiness,That I was blessed and could bless.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book Has No Title
Quote: There are lots of great ideas in my book, but as a cohesive unit, my book is only held together with glue at the spine. Or it would be, if it weren’t an ebook.

Author: Frank E. Peretti
Quote: the depth of a person's character is not measured by his or her physical strength, but by the depth of his or her nobility.

Author: Daniel Pennac
Quote: If you`re wondering how you`ll find time, it means you don`t really want to read. Because nobody`s ever got time. Children certainly haven`t, nor have teenagers or grown-ups. Life always gets in the way. <...>Time to read is always time stolen. <...>Stolen from what? From the tyranny of living.”- p.125

Author: Carole Maso,  Room Lit By Roses
Quote: I believe in books.

Author: Alberto Manguel,  The Library at Night
Quote: Digestion of words as well; I often read aloud to myself in my writing corner in the library, where no one can hear me, for the sake of better savouring the text, so as to make it all the more mine.

Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Shadow of the Wind
Quote: As it unfolded, the structure of the story began to remind me of one of those Russian dolls that contain innumerable ever-smaller dolls within. Step by step the narrative split into a thousand stories, as if it had entered a gallery of mirrors, its identity fragmented into endless reflections.

Author: Jessica Zafra,  Twisted 9
Quote: That's the thing about a great book. Every time you read it, it's different, because you're different. You've changed since the last time you picked it up, things have happened to you.

Author: Anatole France
Quote: The books that everybody admires are those that nobody reads.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: Our experience is coloured through and through by books and plays and the cinema, and it takes patience and skill to disentangle the things we have really learned from life for ourselves.

Author: Frances Hodgson Burnett,  A Little Princess
Quote: Never did she find anything so difficult as to keep herself from losing her temper when she was suddenly disturbed while absorbed in a book.

Author: Edwin Markham
Quote: He fed his spirit with the bread of books

Author: Jayce O'Neal
Quote: You can't judge a book by it's cover but you can sure sell a bunch of books if you have a good one.

Author: Roald Dahl,  The BFG
Quote: You is getting nosier than a parker.

Author: Emma Donoghue,  Slammerkin
Quote: For all the books in his possession, he still failed to read the stories written plain as day in the faces of the people around him.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: New International Version
Quote: Jesus did many other things as well. If every one of them were written down, I suppose that even the whole world would not have room for the books that would be written.

Author: David Mitchell,  Cloud Atlas
Quote: Un libro leído a medias es una aventura amorosa incompleta.

Author: Jane Austen,  Persuasion
Quote: ...I will not allow books to prove any thing.""But how shall we prove any thing?""We never shall.

Author: Kellie Elmore,  Magic in the Backyard
Quote: Maybe Heaven will be a library and then I might get to finish my ‘to-read’ list.

Author: Tara Bray Smith
Quote: Certain bookworms eat books. Eat them, swear in them, spill things on them.

Author: Alberto Manguel,  The Library at Night
Quote: One book calls to another unexpectedly, creating alliances across different cultures and centuries.

Author: Adriana Trigiani,  Big Stone Gap
Quote: People have often told me that one of their strongest childhood memories is the scent of their grandmother's house. I never knew my grandmothers, but I could always count of the Bookmobile.

Author: J. Patrick Lewis
Quote: A great book is a homing deviceFor navigating paradise.A good book somehow makes you careAbout the comfort of a chair.A bad book owes to many treesA forest of apologies.

Author: Helen Simonson,  Major Pettigrew's Last Stand
Quote: ...I tell myself it does not matter what one reads--favorite authors, particular themes--as long as we read something. It is not even important to own the books.

Author: Anne Fadiman,  At Large and at Small: Familiar Essays
Quote: One of the convenient things about literature is that, despite copyrights [...] a book belongs to the reader as well as to the writer.

Author: Virginia Woolf,  The Waves
Quote: Beneath my eyes opens -- a book; I see to the bottom; the heart -- I see to the depths. I know what loves are trembling into fire; how jealousy shoots its green flashes hither and thither; how intricately love crosses love; love makes knots; love brutally tears them apart. I have been knotted; I have been torn apart.

Author: Nancy Byrd Turner
Quote: The Bookshop has a thousand books,All colors, hues, and tinges,And every cover is a doorThat turns on magic hinges.

Author: Laurie R. King,  The Beekeeper's Apprentice
Quote: I took to the Bodleian library as to a lover and ... would sit long hours in Bodley's arms to emerge, blinking and dazed with the small and feel of all those books.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke,  The Notebooks of Malte Laurids Brigge
Quote: There are a large number of people in the room, but one is unaware of them. They are in the books. At times they move among the pages, like sleepers turning over between two dreams. Ah, how good it is to be among people who are reading.

Author: نجلاء حسن,  قلب صام عن هوى الرجال
Quote: إحدى يديه كانت منهمكة بالعبث في خصلات شعريوالأخرى كان ينفث بها سيجارته ،إلتقطتها منه بغضب وبإمتعاض ممقوتوهمست له : دعها تلك اللعينة فلن أسمح بأن تشاركني فيك !

Author: Saadi
Quote: However much you study, you cannot know without action. A donkey laden with books is neither an intellectual nor a wise man. Empty of essence, what learning has he whether upon him is firewood or book?

Author: Alberto Manguel,  The Library at Night
Quote: It hardly matters why a library is destroyed: every banning, curtailment, shredding, plunder or loot gives rise (at least as a ghostly presence) to a louder, clearer, more durable library of the banned, looted, plundered, shredded or curtailed.

Author: Lawrence Clark Powell
Quote: Unless their use by readers bring them to life, books are indeed dead things.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book Has No Title
Quote: If I’m going to write a book every American will want to read, it’s got to have lots of pictures. Those pictures must also move, and all the words in the book must be spoken and available audibly for all the readers to hear as they watch.

Author: Paul Simon,  Simon and Garfunkel's Greatest Hits
Quote: We note our place with bookmarkersThat measure what we've lost.

Author: Deb Caletti,  Honey, Baby, Sweetheart
Quote: If time heals all wounds, and a book can hold a person's entire life, then you can speed up the process with a pulp time warp.

Author: Lawrence Clark Powell
Quote: We are the children of a technological age. We have found streamlined ways of doing much of our routine work. Printing is no longer the only way of reproducing books. Reading them, however, has not changed.

Author: Douglas Coupland,  Generation A
Quote: Books turn people into isolated individuals, and once that's happened, the road only grows rockier. Books wire you to want to be Steve McQueen, but the world wants you to be SMcQ23667bot@hotmail.com.

Author: Daniel Pennac
Quote: We keep quiet about what we read. Our enjoyment of a book remains a jealously guarded secret. Perhaps because there`s no need to talk, or because it takes time to distill what we've read before we can say anything. Silence is our guarantee of intimacy. We might have finished reading but we`re still livingthe book.

Author: P.G. Wodehouse
Quote: One of the poets, whose name I cannot recall, has a passage, which I am unable at the moment to remember, in one of his works, which for the time being has slipped my mind, which hits off admirably this age-old situation.

Author: Jeanette Winterson,  Why Be Happy When You Could Be Normal?
Quote: A tough life needs a tough language—and that is what poetry is. That is what literature offers—a language powerful enough to say how it is.

Author: Alex de Campi
Quote: There's nothing on Earth like really nailing the last line of a big book. You have 200 pages to tickle their fancy, and seven words to break their heart.

Author: Bich Minh Nguyen,  Stealing Buddha's Dinner
Quote: I read to be alone. I read so as not to be alone.

Author: Neil Gaiman
Quote: Soon enough his head would be swimming with tales of derring-do and high adventure, tales of beautiful maidens kissed, of evildoers shot with pistols or fought with swords, of bags of gold, of diamonds as big as the tip of your thumb, of lost cities and of vast mountains, of steam-trains and clipper ships, of pampas, oceans, deserts, tundra.

Author: Ellen Kushner
Quote: Not being the sort to throw a book, she pounded her fist on her cushion.

Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
Quote: Un buen escritor se aprecia mejor por lo que rompe que por lo que publica.

Author: James Goldsmith
Quote: The first time I read an excellent work, it is to me just as if I gained a new friend; and when I read over a book I have perused before, it resembles the meeting of an old one.

Author: Elizabeth von Arnim,  The Solitary Summer
Quote: What a blessing it is to love books. Everybody must love something, and I know of no objects of love that give such substantial and unfailing returns as books and a garden.

Author: Emily Dickinson,  The Complete Poems
Quote: A precious, mouldering pleasure ’t is To meet an antique book, In just the dress his century wore; A privilege, I think.

Author: Stephen King,  The Waste Lands
Quote: Jake went in, aware that he had, for the first time in three weeks, opened a door without hoping madly to find another world on the other side. A bell jingled overhead. The mild, spicy smell of old books hit him, and the smell was somehow like coming home.

Author: Desiderius Erasmus
Quote: Before you sleep, read something that is exquisite, and worth remembering.

Author: Stefanos Livos
Quote: Literature is the real life of imaginary people.

Author: Jerry Spinelli
Quote: And so I'm me again, Leo. Thanks to the example of a five-year-old. I'm hoping you wouldn't want it any other way. Not that you weren't flattered, right? I mean, to have a girl two thousand miles away going to pieces over you, weeping at the mere memory of you, losing her appetite, losing herself and self-respect - well, that's trophy enough for any guy's ego, huh?

Author: George Orwell,  A Collection of Essays
Quote: There are books that one reads over and over again, books that become part of the furniture of one’s mind and alter one’s whole attitude to life, books that one dips into but never reads through, books that one reads at a single sitting and forgets a week later:

Author: Kurt Vonnegut,  Palm Sunday: An Autobiographical Collage
Quote: By reading the writings of the most interesting minds in history, we meditate with our own minds and theirs as well. This is to me is a miracle.

Author: Karen Marie Moning,  Shadowfever
Quote: I love books, they're in my blood.

Author: Alberto Manguel,  The Library at Night
Quote: In the dark, with the windows lit and the rows of books glittering, the library is a closed space, a universe of self-serving rules that pretend to replace or translate those of the shapeless universe beyond.

Author: Rachel Kadish,  Tolstoy Lied: A Love Story
Quote: Books. People have no idea how beautiful books are. How they taste on your fingers. How bright everything is when you light it with words.

Author: Patricia A. McKillip
Quote: Epics are never written about libraries. They exist on whim; it depends on if the conquering army likes to read.

Author: Victor Nell,  Lost in a Book: The Psychology of Reading for Pleasure
Quote: Books are all the dreams we would most like to have and like dreams they have the power to change consciousness.

Author: Nicholas Tucker,  Darkness Visible: Inside the World of Philip Pullman
Quote: Don Quixote could never manage without his patient servant Sancho Panza.

Author: R. D. Cumming
Quote: A good book has no ending.

Author: Laura Jensen Walker,  Daring Chloe
Quote: How do you explain to a nonreader that books aren't just things but treasured friends? Companions?

Author: Dan Simmons,  The Terror
Quote: Luckily, even as a young man not yet become himself, John Bridgens had two things besides indecision that kept him from self-destruction - books and a sense of irony.

Author: Alberto Manguel,  The Library at Night
Quote: There is a line of poetry, a sentence in a fable, a word in an essay, by which my existence is justified; find that line, and immortality is assured.

Author: Bauvard,  Some Inspiration for the Overenthusiastic
Quote: I hope people of the future will remember my books for being burned, and I challenge an elite few to imagine the embers of the last copy.

Author: Christopher Morley
Quote: The world has been printing books for 450 years, and yet gunpowder still has a wider circulation. Never mind! Printer's ink is the greater explosive: it will win.

Author: Berkeley Breathed
Quote: Some of us find our lives abridged even before the paperback comes out.

Author: Rita Mae Brown,  Rubyfruit Jungle
Quote: Oh well, maybe the only beauty left in cities is in the oil slicks on the road and maybe there isn't any beauty left in the people who live in these places.

Author: Louis L'Amour,  Education of a Wandering Man
Quote: Books are precious things, but more than that, they are the strong backbone of civilization. They are the thread upon which it all hangs, and they can save us when all else is lost.

Author: علي الطنطاوي,  مقالات في كلمات
Quote: فإني قرأت كتاباً في تعريف الجمال كثيرة، فلم اجد احد من تعريف طاغور: "إن الجمال هو الاخلاص

Author: Paul Acampora,  I Kill the Mockingbird
Quote: Shelving books incorrectly is as good as stealing them. It's almost worse.

Author: Douglas Rushkoff
Quote: The function of a book is to provide a reading experience.

Author: Nick Hornby,  The Polysyllabic Spree
Quote: We are never allowed to forget that some books are badly written; we should remember that sometimes they're badly read, too.

Author: Laura Amy Schlitz,  The Hired Girl
Quote: But I think the most important thing those books gave me was a kind of faith. My books promised me that life wasn’t just made up of workaday tasks and prosaic things. The world is bigger and more colorful and more important than that.

Author: Mitch Albom
Quote: A book with the genuine power to stir and comfort its readers.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  The Titanic would never have sunk if it were made out of a sink.
Quote: This book comes with its very own logo (logo sold separately).
